channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports

item.title: 2025 Silver Pigskin Fan Vote
item.description: SAN DIEGO -- For nearly 30 years, the Prep Pigskin Report has awarded the top prize in high school sports at the annual Silver Pigskin Gala. The Red Jacket Select Committee has made their selections for the first four nominees, and now it's up to YOU to choose the fifth.
item.dc:creator: Brandon Stone, Fox 5

item.title: Blue Jays' Max Scherzer gets second World Series Game 7 start after Dodgers force winner-take-all
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Max Scherzer is about to become the only living pitcher to start two winner-take-all Game 7s in the World Series.
item.dc:creator: RONALD BLUM, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Double trouble: Barger gets caught off second base as Blue Jays' rally fizzles in Game 6 of Series
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Addison Barger was thinking base hit off the bat — and he was going to score the tying run for Toronto in the ninth inning Friday night. Then, in a flash, he got doubled off second and Game 6 was over. Just like that.
item.dc:creator: ROB GILLIES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts says Shohei Ohtani a possibility to start Game 7 of World Series
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Shohei Ohtani might start Game 7 of the World Series on Saturday. Tyler Glasnow might pitch on back-to-back days. For Los Angeles Dodgers manager Dave Roberts, the only certainty is that Yoshinobu Yamamoto won't pitch. Besides that? "Everyone will be available," Roberts said.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: George Springer drives in Toronto's lone run as he returns for World Series Game 6 against Dodgers
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — George Springer hit an RBI single for the Blue Jays' lone run in Game 6 of the World Series on Friday night, making an impact after missing two games with an injury to his right side in Toronto's 3-1 loss to the Los Angeles Dodgers.
item.dc:creator: ROB GILLIES, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Dodgers force World Series to deciding Game 7 by holding off Blue Jays 3-1 as Yamamoto wins again
item.description: By RONALD BLUM TORONTO (AP) — Yoshinobu Yamamoto beat Toronto for the second time in a week, slumping Mookie Betts hit a two-run single in a three-run third inning and the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers held off the Blue Jays 3-1 on Friday night to force the World Series to a decisive
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, The Mercury News

item.title: Dodgers force World Series to deciding Game 7 by holding off Blue Jays 3-1 as Yamamoto wins again
item.description: Yoshinobu Yamamoto beat Toronto for the second time in a week, slumping Mookie Betts hit a two-run single in a three-run third inning and the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers held off the Blue Jays 3-1 to force the World Series to a decisive Game 7.
item.dc:creator: Ronald Blum, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Stephen A. Smith suggests racial implications in Dolphins' decision to part ways with general manager
item.description: Stephen A. Smith implied racial bias in the Miami Dolphins’ decision to part ways with general manager Chris Grier before head coach Mike McDaniel.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Miami Dolphins and General Manager Chris Grier agree to part ways
item.description: MIAMI GARDENS, Fla. (AP) — The Miami Dolphins and Chris Grier have agreed to part ways, ending his 10-year tenure as general manager. The decision comes after Miami fell to 2-7 on the season following Thursday night’s 28-6 rout against the Baltimore Ravens.
item.dc:creator: ALANIS THAMES, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: The NBA is extending its relationship with one of the sporting world’s most intriguing start-up companies
item.description: The NBA and Cosm, the entertainment company that’s reinventing the sports bar with what they like to call “shared reality,” announced Thursday an extended partnership to air live NBA games in Cosm’s domes.
item.dc:creator: CNN.com Wire Service, The Mercury News

item.title: Auger-Aliassime ends Vacherot's impressive run at the Paris Masters
item.description: PARIS (AP) — Felix Auger-Aliassime ended Valentin Vacherot’s impressive run at the Paris Masters on Friday with a 6-2, 6-2 win in the quarterfinals.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Munich set to host Champions League final in 2028. Wembley and Camp Nou compete for 2029 final
item.description: GENEVA (AP) — Bayern Munich’s stadium is set to host another Champions League final in 2028, and staging the 2029 final is a contest between Wembley Stadium in London and Barcelona’s renovated Camp Nou.
item.dc:creator: GRAHAM DUNBAR, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Jonas Williams, Trey Serauskis aim to lead Lincoln-Way East to IHSA state title
item.description: FRANKFORT, Ill. - His last name is Williams. He's a five-star quarterback and he’s headed to USC to play for Lincoln Riley. No, not that Williams. But, Lincoln-Way East star Jonas Williams does see some similarities between himself and the Bears signal caller with the same number.
item.dc:creator: Josh Frydman, WGN 9

item.title: Lamar Jackson torches Miami with 4 TD passes in return from injury and Ravens rout Dolphins 28-6
item.description: MIAMI GARDENS, Fla. (AP) — Lamar Jackson returned for the Baltimore Ravens, and so did the chants of “M-V-P!” — on the road. Jackson threw for 204 yards and four touchdowns, showing little rust in his return from a right hamstring strain, and the Ravens routed the Miami Dolphins 28-6.
item.dc:creator: ALANIS THAMES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Dolphins rookie furious after being called for questionable penalty vs Ravens
item.description: Miami Dolphins rookie running back Ollie Gordon II exploded on the sideline after he was called for a questionable tripping penalty against the Baltimore Ravens.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Denny Hamlin races for his dying father's last chance to see him win a NASCAR championship
item.description: AVONDALE, Ariz. (AP) — Dennis Hamlin took out multiple mortgages on his Virginia home, maxed out every credit card and nearly went broke trying to get his son into NASCAR.
item.dc:creator: JENNA FRYER, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Injured George Springer on track to play in Game 6 for Blue Jays, manager says
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Injured Blue Jays designated hitter George Springer is on track to play in Game 6 of the World Series on Friday, Toronto manager John Schneider said.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Matchup of powerhouse Chicagoland programs highlights 1st round of IHSA state football playoffs this weekend
item.description: In what surely has to be one of the most significant first-round matchups in IHSA state football playoff history, longtime rivals Chicago Mt. Carmel and Loyola Academy of Wilmette square off at 4:30 p.m. Saturday in the Class 8A bracket, which has the state's largest programs.
item.dc:creator: Michael Johnson, WGN 9

item.title: Snowbasin named #3 ski resort in the West
item.description: HUNTSVILLE, Utah (ABC4 Sports) - Snowbasin Resort has once again been recognized among North America’s best, earning the No. 3 spot in SKI Magazine’s “Top 30 Resorts in the West” for 2026.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: Mobster denied bail as Billups, Rozier await arraignment amid FBI probe
item.description: A member of the notorious Gambino crime family, Angelo Ruggiero Jr. has been denied bail and remains in custody.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Djordjevic, NewsNation

item.title: Connor Bedard scores 3 times as the Blackhawks knock off the Senators 7-3
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Connor Bedard had three goals and an assist in his first career hat trick, and the Chicago Blackhawks beat the Ottawa Senators 7-3 on Tuesday night. Frank Nazar and defenseman Louis Crevier each had a goal and an assist for Chicago in its third win in four games.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Music icon Sting to headline Super Bowl concert series in SF
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (KRON) -- Music icon Sting has been announced as the opening night headliner for a concert series in San Francisco next year set to coincide with the Bay Area's hosting of Super Bowl LX. The 17-time Grammy Award-winning artist is to perform Friday, Feb. 6 at SF's Palace of Fine Arts.
item.dc:creator: Alex Baker, KRON4

item.title: Questionable officiating outshines Bucs win in New Orleans
item.description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers left New Orleans with a dominant 23-3 victory over the Saints, but a pair of questionable calls by NFL officials kept it from being even worse for the home team.
item.dc:creator: Garrett Phillips, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Freeman's homer in 18th inning lifts Dodgers over Blue Jays 6-5 in World Series classic
item.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Freddie Freeman homered leading off the bottom of the 18th inning, Shohei Ohtani went deep twice in another record-setting performance, and the Los Angeles Dodgers outlasted the Toronto Blue Jays 6-5 on Monday night in a World Series classic.
item.dc:creator: BETH HARRIS AP Sports Writer, WFLA, NBC

item.title: NBA at the mercy of FBI in gambling scandal: Stephen A. Smith
item.description: Patel, the FBI director, called out Smith after he said that the arrests may have been a part of President Trump's revenge for all the backlash he receives.
item.dc:creator: Rob Taub, NewsNation

item.title: Former NFL center Nick Mangold dies shortly after sharing he needed kidney transplant
item.description: His death comes less than two weeks after the two-time All-Pro selection announced on social media that he had kidney disease and needed a transplant.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Lakers' Luka Doncic likely out at least one week with a sprained finger and a bruised leg
item.description: Luka Doncic is expected to be sidelined for at least a week because of a sprained finger on his left hand and a bruised lower left leg, the Los Angeles Lakers announced Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Lando Norris snaps losing streak with victory in Mexico City, takes lead in F1 championship
item.description: Lando Norris reclaimed the championship lead from teammate Oscar Piastri by winning in Mexico City on Sunday to snap a five-race losing streak and create a tense final push for the Formula 1 title.
item.dc:creator: JENNA FRYER, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Jury: NCAA to pay $18M to former football player, his wife in concussion lawsuit
item.description: The NCAA owes a former college football player and his wife $18 million, a South Carolina jury decided while finding college sports’ major governing body negligent in failing to warn the player about the long-term effects of concussions.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Former NFL center Nick Mangold dies seeking kidney transplant
item.description: His death comes less than two weeks after the two-time All-Pro selection announced on social media that he had kidney disease and needed a transplant.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: BYU keeps rolling with 41-27 win at Iowa State
item.description: AMES, Iowa (ABC4 Sports) - There was no letdown after the rivalry game this time. Bear Bachmeier threw for 307 yards and two touchdowns, both to Parker Kingston, as the 11th-ranked Cougars came from 14 points down to beat Iowa State Saturday afternoon, 41-27.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: USF football falls in heartbreaker at Memphis, 34-31
item.description: No. 18-ranked South Florida (6-2, 3-1 American) saw Memphis (7-1; 3-1 American) come back from a 14-point deficit entering the fourth quarter to claim a 34-31 victory over the Bulls Saturday at Liberty Bowl Stadium in Memphis.
item.dc:creator: Brian Siegrist, WFLA, NBC
